thread.title: Technology Sector Update for 10/16/2015: MBLY,TSLA,NETE,STX - Nasdaq
thread.title_full: Technology Sector Update for 10/16/2015: MBLY,TSLA,NETE,STX - Nasdaq

title: Technology Sector Update for 10/16/2015: MBLY,TSLA,NETE,STX - Nasdaq
text:
CSCO -0.20% 
GOOG -0.26% 
Technology stocks were little changed this afternoon, with shares of technology companies in the S&P 500 slipping less than 0.1%. 
In company news, Mobileye NV ( MBLY ) was sputtering this afternoon, giving back morning gains that continued to follow Tesla Motors ( TSLA ) earlier this week unveiling the Autopilot v7.0 feature for its Model S electric cars using Mobileye's camera-based driver-assistance software. 
Mobileye technology provides vision and data analysis tools enabling vehicles to automatically steer, change lanes, and park on their own. Tesla began installing the new software on Wednesday, expecting to complete the update in around 60,000 Model S cars over the next week. 
MBLY shares were down 0.21% at $49.74 each, giving back a prior advance that lifted the stock as high as $52.00 a share today. TSLA stock was higher today, rising 2.5% to $226.85 a share. 
In other sector news, 
(+) NETE, (+12.2%) Terminates $5 million of its senior convertible notes. 
(-) STX, (-6.1%) Pacific Crest downgrade to Sector Weight from Overweight, keeping $48 price target.
